meanings.def: a description of somebody/something that gives useful information
examples: We first build up a detailed profile of our customers and their requirements.
You can update your Facebook profile (= your description of yourself on a social media website).
He fits the profile of the killer.
The magazine published a short profile of the new mayor.
a job/employee profile
His psychological profile is revealing.
The job profile suits his experience exactly.
Margo was told to write a profile about him.
an in-depth profile of Boris Spassky and his career

meanings.def: the general impression that somebody/something gives to the public and the amount of attention they receive
examples: Her popularity has done great things for the profile of the sport.
The deal will certainly raise the company's international profile.
We want to improve the profile of women’s health issues.
a campaign to boost the profile of the city as a cultural leader

meanings.def: the outline of a person’s face when you look from the side, not the front
examples: his strong profile
She presented her best profile to the camera.
in profile a picture of the president in profile

meanings.def: the edge or outline of something that you see against a background
examples: the profile of the tower against the sky

meanings.def: the amount of attention somebody/something has from the public
examples: This issue has had a high profile in recent months.
I advised her to keep a low profile for the next few days (= not to attract attention).
The story was given a low profile in today's papers.

idioms.def: the amount of attention somebody/something has from the public
examples: This issue has had a high profile in recent months.
I advised her to keep a low profile for the next few days (= not to attract attention).
The story was given a low profile in today's papers.

meanings.def: to give or write a description of somebody/something that gives the most important information
examples: His career is profiled in this month's journal.
